Class Add_Two_Numbers_II

java.lang.Object
Add_Two_Numbers_II
public class Add_Two_Numbers_II extends Object
LeetCode 445: Add Two Numbers II Problem Description: --------------------- You are given two non-empty linked lists representing two non-negative integers. - The most significant digit comes first. - Each node contains a single digit. - Add the two numbers and return the sum as a linked list. Constraints: - Each linked list represents a number without leading zeros. - Length of lists: [1, 100]. - Node values: [0, 9]. Example: Input: l1 = [7,2,4,3], l2 = [5,6,4] Output: [7,8,0,7] Explanation: 7243 + 564 = 7807

  • Constructor Details

    • Add_Two_Numbers_II

  • Method Details

    • addTwoNumbersStack

      public ListNode addTwoNumbersStack(ListNode l1, ListNode l2)
      Approach 1: Using Stacks ------------------------- Idea: - Since digits are given in forward order, we need to process from the end. - Stacks help us access digits from least significant to most significant. Steps: 1. Push all digits of l1 into stack s1, and all digits of l2 into stack s2. Example: l1 = [7,2,4,3] → s1 = [7,2,4,3] l2 = [5,6,4] → s2 = [5,6,4] 2. Pop values from stacks and add them with carry: - sum = x + y + carry - digit = sum % 10 - carry = sum / 10 - Create a new node for digit and prepend it to the result. 3. If carry > 0 after processing, add a new node at the front. Example Trace: s1=[7,2,4,3], s2=[5,6,4], carry=0 → Pop 3+4=7 → node=7 → Pop 4+6=10 → digit=0, carry=1 → node=0, list=[0,7] → Pop 2+5+1=8 → node=8, list=[8,0,7] → Pop 7+0=7 → node=7, list=[7,8,0,7]

    • addTwoNumbersEfficient

      public ListNode addTwoNumbersEfficient(ListNode l1, ListNode l2)
      Approach 2: Reverse + Add + Reverse Back ----------------------------------------- Idea: - If we reverse the input lists, the digits become least-significant-first, which reduces the problem to LeetCode 2 ("Add Two Numbers"). - After addition, reverse the result back. Steps: 1. Reverse both input lists. Example: l1 = [7,2,4,3] → [3,4,2,7] l2 = [5,6,4] → [4,6,5] 2. Perform digit-by-digit addition: - sum = x + y + carry - digit = sum % 10 - carry = sum / 10 - Append new nodes at the end of result. 3. If carry > 0 at the end, add a new node. 4. Reverse the result back to forward order. Example Trace: l1=[3,4,2,7], l2=[4,6,5], carry=0 → 3+4=7 → [7] → 4+6=10 → digit=0, carry=1 → [7,0] → 2+5+1=8 → [7,0,8] → 7+0=7 → [7,0,8,7] Reverse → [7,8,0,7]
